trans-unit.source: Networking for games
trans-unit.target: Networking for games

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop and incorporate networking features into your DirectX game.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop and incorporate networking features into your DirectX game.

trans-unit.source: Networking for games
trans-unit.target: Networking for games

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Learn how to develop and incorporate networking features into your DirectX game.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to develop and incorporate networking features into your DirectX game.

trans-unit.source: Concepts at a glance
trans-unit.target: Concepts at a glance

trans-unit.source: A variety of networking features can be used in your DirectX game, whether it is a simple standalone game to massively multi-player games.
trans-unit.target: A variety of networking features can be used in your DirectX game, whether it is a simple standalone game to massively multi-player games.

trans-unit.source: The simplest use of networking would be to store user names and game scores on a central network server.
trans-unit.target: The simplest use of networking would be to store user names and game scores on a central network server.

trans-unit.source: Networking APIs are needed in multi-player games that use the infrastructure (client-server or internet peer-to-peer) model and also by ad hoc (local peer-to-peer) games.
trans-unit.target: Networking APIs are needed in multi-player games that use the infrastructure (client-server or internet peer-to-peer) model and also by ad hoc (local peer-to-peer) games.

trans-unit.source: For server-based multi-player games, a central game server usually handles most of the game operations and the client game app is used for input, displaying graphics, playing audio, and other features.
trans-unit.target: For server-based multi-player games, a central game server usually handles most of the game operations and the client game app is used for input, displaying graphics, playing audio, and other features.

trans-unit.source: The speed and latency of network transfers is a concern for a satisfactory game experience.
trans-unit.target: The speed and latency of network transfers is a concern for a satisfactory game experience.

trans-unit.source: For peer-to-peer games, each player's app handles the input and graphics.
trans-unit.target: For peer-to-peer games, each player's app handles the input and graphics.

trans-unit.source: In most cases, the game players are located in close proximity so that network latency should be lower but is still a concern.
trans-unit.target: In most cases, the game players are located in close proximity so that network latency should be lower but is still a concern.

trans-unit.source: How to discovery peers and establish a connection becomes a concern.
trans-unit.target: How to discovery peers and establish a connection becomes a concern.

trans-unit.source: For single-player games, a central Web server or service is often used to store user names, game scores, and other miscellaneous information.
trans-unit.target: For single-player games, a central Web server or service is often used to store user names, game scores, and other miscellaneous information.

trans-unit.source: In these games, the speed and latency of networking transfers is less of a concern since it doesn't directly affect game operation.
trans-unit.target: In these games, the speed and latency of networking transfers is less of a concern since it doesn't directly affect game operation.

trans-unit.source: Network conditions can change at any time, so any game that uses networking APIs needs to handle network exceptions that may occur.
trans-unit.target: Network conditions can change at any time, so any game that uses networking APIs needs to handle network exceptions that may occur.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about handling network exceptions, see [Networking basics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt280233).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about handling network exceptions, see [Networking basics](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt280233).

trans-unit.source: Firewalls and web proxies are common and can affect the ability to use networking features.
trans-unit.target: Firewalls and web proxies are common and can affect the ability to use networking features.

trans-unit.source: A game that uses networking needs to be prepared to properly handle firewalls and proxies.
trans-unit.target: A game that uses networking needs to be prepared to properly handle firewalls and proxies.

trans-unit.source: For mobile devices, it is important to monitor available network resources and behave accordingly when on metered networks where roaming or data costs can be significant.
trans-unit.target: For mobile devices, it is important to monitor available network resources and behave accordingly when on metered networks where roaming or data costs can be significant.

trans-unit.source: Network isolation is part of the app security model used by Windows.
trans-unit.target: Network isolation is part of the app security model used by Windows.

trans-unit.source: Windows actively discovers network boundaries and enforces network access restrictions for network isolation.
trans-unit.target: Windows actively discovers network boundaries and enforces network access restrictions for network isolation.

trans-unit.source: Apps must declare network isolation capabilities in order to define the scope of network access.
trans-unit.target: Apps must declare network isolation capabilities in order to define the scope of network access.

trans-unit.source: Without declaring these capabilities, your app will not have access to network resources.
trans-unit.target: Without declaring these capabilities, your app will not have access to network resources.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about how Windows enforces network isolation for apps, see [How to configure network isolation capabilities](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh770532).
trans-unit.target: To learn more about how Windows enforces network isolation for apps, see [How to configure network isolation capabilities](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh770532).

trans-unit.source: Design considerations
trans-unit.target: Design considerations

trans-unit.source: A variety of networking APIs can be used in DirectX games.
trans-unit.target: A variety of networking APIs can be used in DirectX games.

trans-unit.source: So, it is important to pick the right API.
trans-unit.target: So, it is important to pick the right API.

trans-unit.source: Windows supports a variety of networking APIs that your app can use to communicate with other computers and devices over either the Internet or private networks.
trans-unit.target: Windows supports a variety of networking APIs that your app can use to communicate with other computers and devices over either the Internet or private networks.

trans-unit.source: Your first step is to figure out what networking features your app needs.
trans-unit.target: Your first step is to figure out what networking features your app needs.

trans-unit.source: The more popular network APIs for games include:
trans-unit.target: The more popular network APIs for games include:

trans-unit.source: TCP and sockets - Provides a reliable connection.
trans-unit.target: TCP and sockets - Provides a reliable connection.

trans-unit.source: Use TCP for game operations that don’t need security.
trans-unit.target: Use TCP for game operations that don’t need security.

trans-unit.source: TCP allows the server to easily scale, so it is commonly used in games that use the infrastructure (client-server or internet peer-to-peer) model.
trans-unit.target: TCP allows the server to easily scale, so it is commonly used in games that use the infrastructure (client-server or internet peer-to-peer) model.

trans-unit.source: TCP can also be used by ad hoc (local peer-to-peer) games over Wi-Fi Direct and Bluetooth.
trans-unit.target: TCP can also be used by ad hoc (local peer-to-peer) games over Wi-Fi Direct and Bluetooth.

trans-unit.source: TCP is commonly used for game object movement, character interaction, text chat, and other operations.
trans-unit.target: TCP is commonly used for game object movement, character interaction, text chat, and other operations.

trans-unit.source: The [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) class provides a TCP socket that can be used in Windows Store games.
trans-unit.target: The [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) class provides a TCP socket that can be used in Windows Store games.

trans-unit.source: The **StreamSocket** class is used with related classes in the [**Windows::Networking::Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960) namespace.
trans-unit.target: The **StreamSocket** class is used with related classes in the [**Windows::Networking::Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960) namespace.

trans-unit.source: TCP and sockets using SSL - Provides a reliable connection that prevents eavesdropping.
trans-unit.target: TCP and sockets using SSL - Provides a reliable connection that prevents eavesdropping.

trans-unit.source: Use TCP connections with SSL for game operations that need security.
trans-unit.target: Use TCP connections with SSL for game operations that need security.

trans-unit.source: The encryption and overhead of SSL adds a cost in latency and performance, so it is only used when security is needed.
trans-unit.target: The encryption and overhead of SSL adds a cost in latency and performance, so it is only used when security is needed.

trans-unit.source: TCP with SSL is commonly used for login, purchasing and trading assets, game character creation and management.
trans-unit.target: TCP with SSL is commonly used for login, purchasing and trading assets, game character creation and management.

trans-unit.source: The [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) class provides a TCP socket that supports SSL.
trans-unit.target: The [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882) class provides a TCP socket that supports SSL.

trans-unit.source: UDP and sockets - Provides unreliable network transfers with low overhead.
trans-unit.target: UDP and sockets - Provides unreliable network transfers with low overhead.

trans-unit.source: UDP is used for game operations that require low latency and can tolerate some packet loss.
trans-unit.target: UDP is used for game operations that require low latency and can tolerate some packet loss.

trans-unit.source: This is often used for fighting games, shooting and tracers, network audio, and voice chat.
trans-unit.target: This is often used for fighting games, shooting and tracers, network audio, and voice chat.

trans-unit.source: The [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319) class provides a UDP socket that can be used in Windows Store games.
trans-unit.target: The [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319) class provides a UDP socket that can be used in Windows Store games.

trans-unit.source: The **DatagramSocket** class is used with related classes in the [**Windows::Networking::Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960) namespace.
trans-unit.target: The **DatagramSocket** class is used with related classes in the [**Windows::Networking::Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960) namespace.

trans-unit.source: HTTP Client - Provides a reliable connection to HTTP servers.
trans-unit.target: HTTP Client - Provides a reliable connection to HTTP servers.

trans-unit.source: The most common networking scenario is to access a web site to retrieve or store information.
trans-unit.target: The most common networking scenario is to access a web site to retrieve or store information.

trans-unit.source: A simple example would be a game that uses a website to store user information and game scores.
trans-unit.target: A simple example would be a game that uses a website to store user information and game scores.

trans-unit.source: When used with SSL for security, an HTTP client can be used for login, purchasing, trading assets, game character creation, and management.
trans-unit.target: When used with SSL for security, an HTTP client can be used for login, purchasing, trading assets, game character creation, and management.

trans-unit.source: The [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) class provides a modern HTTP client API for use in Windows Store games.
trans-unit.target: The [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) class provides a modern HTTP client API for use in Windows Store games.

trans-unit.source: The **HttpClient** class is used with related classes in the [**Windows::Web::Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace.
trans-unit.target: The **HttpClient** class is used with related classes in the [**Windows::Web::Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace.

trans-unit.source: Handling network exceptions in your DirectX game
trans-unit.target: Handling network exceptions in your DirectX game

trans-unit.source: When a network exception occurs in your DirectX game, this indicates a significant problem or failure.
trans-unit.target: When a network exception occurs in your DirectX game, this indicates a significant problem or failure.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions can occur for many reasons when using networking APIs.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions can occur for many reasons when using networking APIs.

trans-unit.source: Often, the exception can result from changes in network connectivity or other networking issues with the remote host or server.
trans-unit.target: Often, the exception can result from changes in network connectivity or other networking issues with the remote host or server.

trans-unit.source: Some causes of exceptions when using networking APIs include the following:
trans-unit.target: Some causes of exceptions when using networking APIs include the following:

trans-unit.source: Input from the user for a hostname or a URI contains errors and is not valid.
trans-unit.target: Input from the user for a hostname or a URI contains errors and is not valid.

trans-unit.source: Name resolutions failures when looking up a hostname or a URi.
trans-unit.target: Name resolutions failures when looking up a hostname or a URi.

trans-unit.source: Loss or change in network connectivity.
trans-unit.target: Loss or change in network connectivity.

trans-unit.source: Network connection failures using sockets or the HTTP client APIs.
trans-unit.target: Network connection failures using sockets or the HTTP client APIs.

trans-unit.source: Network server or remote endpoint errors.
trans-unit.target: Network server or remote endpoint errors.

trans-unit.source: Miscellaneous networking errors.
trans-unit.target: Miscellaneous networking errors.

trans-unit.source: Exceptions from network errors (for example, loss or change of connectivity, connection failures, and server failures) can happen at any time.
trans-unit.target: Exceptions from network errors (for example, loss or change of connectivity, connection failures, and server failures) can happen at any time.

trans-unit.source: These errors result in exceptions being thrown.
trans-unit.target: These errors result in exceptions being thrown.

trans-unit.source: If an exception is not handled by your app, it can cause your entire app to be terminated by the runtime.
trans-unit.target: If an exception is not handled by your app, it can cause your entire app to be terminated by the runtime.

trans-unit.source: You must write code to handle exceptions when you call most asynchronous network methods.
trans-unit.target: You must write code to handle exceptions when you call most asynchronous network methods.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes, when an exception occurs, a network method can be retried as a way to resolve the problem.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes, when an exception occurs, a network method can be retried as a way to resolve the problem.

trans-unit.source: Other times, your app may need to plan to continue without network connectivity using previously cached data.
trans-unit.target: Other times, your app may need to plan to continue without network connectivity using previously cached data.

trans-unit.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps generally throw a single exception.
trans-unit.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps generally throw a single exception.

trans-unit.source: Your exception handler can retrieve more detailed information about the cause of the exception to better understand the failure and make appropriate decisions.
trans-unit.target: Your exception handler can retrieve more detailed information about the cause of the exception to better understand the failure and make appropriate decisions.

trans-unit.source: When an exception occurs in a DirectX game that is a UWP app, the **HRESULT** value for the cause of the error can be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: When an exception occurs in a DirectX game that is a UWP app, the **HRESULT** value for the cause of the error can be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: The *Winerror.h* include file contains a large list of possible **HRESULT** values that includes network errors.
trans-unit.target: The *Winerror.h* include file contains a large list of possible **HRESULT** values that includes network errors.

trans-unit.source: The networking APIs support different methods for retrieving this detailed information about the cause of an exception.
trans-unit.target: The networking APIs support different methods for retrieving this detailed information about the cause of an exception.

trans-unit.source: A method to retrieve the **HRESULT** value of the error that caused the exception.
trans-unit.target: A method to retrieve the **HRESULT** value of the error that caused the exception.

trans-unit.source: The possible list of potential **HRESULT** values is large and unspecified.
trans-unit.target: The possible list of potential **HRESULT** values is large and unspecified.

trans-unit.source: The **HRESULT** value can be retrieved when using any of the networking APIs.
trans-unit.target: The **HRESULT** value can be retrieved when using any of the networking APIs.

trans-unit.source: A helper method that converts the **HRESULT** value to an enumeration value.
trans-unit.target: A helper method that converts the **HRESULT** value to an enumeration value.

trans-unit.source: The list of possible enumeration values is specified and relatively small.
trans-unit.target: The list of possible enumeration values is specified and relatively small.

trans-unit.source: A helper method is available for the socket classes in the [**Windows::Networking::Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960).
trans-unit.target: A helper method is available for the socket classes in the [**Windows::Networking::Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960).

trans-unit.source: Exceptions in Windows.Networking.Sockets
trans-unit.target: Exceptions in Windows.Networking.Sockets

trans-unit.source: The constructor for the [**HostName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207113) class used with sockets can throw an exception if the string passed is not a valid hostname (contains characters that are not allowed in a host name).
trans-unit.target: The constructor for the [**HostName**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207113) class used with sockets can throw an exception if the string passed is not a valid hostname (contains characters that are not allowed in a host name).

trans-unit.source: If an app gets input from the user for the **HostName** for a peer connection for gaming, the constructor should be in a try/catch block.
trans-unit.target: If an app gets input from the user for the **HostName** for a peer connection for gaming, the constructor should be in a try/catch block.

trans-unit.source: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new hostname.
trans-unit.target: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new hostname.

trans-unit.source: Add code to validate a string for a hostname from the user
trans-unit.target: Add code to validate a string for a hostname from the user

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960) namespace has convenient helper methods and enumerations for handling errors when using sockets.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960) namespace has convenient helper methods and enumerations for handling errors when using sockets.

trans-unit.source: This can be useful for handling specific network exceptions differently in your app.
trans-unit.target: This can be useful for handling specific network exceptions differently in your app.

trans-unit.source: An error encountered on [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) operation results in an exception being thrown.
trans-unit.target: An error encountered on [**DatagramSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241319), [**StreamSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226882), or [**StreamSocketListener**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226906) operation results in an exception being thrown.

trans-unit.source: The cause of the exception is an error value represented as an **HRESULT** value.
trans-unit.target: The cause of the exception is an error value represented as an **HRESULT** value.

trans-unit.source: The [**SocketError.GetStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701462) method is used to convert a network error from a socket operation to a [**SocketErrorStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701457) enumeration value.
trans-unit.target: The [**SocketError.GetStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701462) method is used to convert a network error from a socket operation to a [**SocketErrorStatus**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh701457) enumeration value.

trans-unit.source: Most of the **SocketErrorStatus** enumeration values correspond to an error returned by the native Windows sockets operation.
trans-unit.target: Most of the **SocketErrorStatus** enumeration values correspond to an error returned by the native Windows sockets operation.

trans-unit.source: An app can filter on specific **SocketErrorStatus** enumeration values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
trans-unit.target: An app can filter on specific **SocketErrorStatus** enumeration values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

trans-unit.source: For parameter validation errors, an app can also use the **HRESULT** from the exception to learn more detailed information about the error that caused the exception.
trans-unit.target: For parameter validation errors, an app can also use the **HRESULT** from the exception to learn more detailed information about the error that caused the exception.

trans-unit.source: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.
trans-unit.target: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.

trans-unit.source: For most parameter validation errors, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_INVALIDARG**.
trans-unit.target: For most parameter validation errors, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_INVALIDARG**.

trans-unit.source: Add code to handle exceptions when trying to make a stream socket connection
trans-unit.target: Add code to handle exceptions when trying to make a stream socket connection

trans-unit.source: Exceptions in Windows.Web.Http
trans-unit.target: Exceptions in Windows.Web.Http

trans-unit.source: The constructor for the [**Windows::Foundation::Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998) class used with [**Windows::Web::Http::HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) can throw an exception if the string passed is not a valid URI (contains characters that are not allowed in a URI).
trans-unit.target: The constructor for the [**Windows::Foundation::Uri**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br225998) class used with [**Windows::Web::Http::HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) can throw an exception if the string passed is not a valid URI (contains characters that are not allowed in a URI).

trans-unit.source: In C++, there is no method to try and parse a string to a URI.
trans-unit.target: In C++, there is no method to try and parse a string to a URI.

trans-unit.source: If an app gets input from the user for the **Windows::Foundation::Uri**, the constructor should be in a try/catch block.
trans-unit.target: If an app gets input from the user for the **Windows::Foundation::Uri**, the constructor should be in a try/catch block.

trans-unit.source: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new URI.
trans-unit.target: If an exception is thrown, the app can notify the user and request a new URI.

trans-unit.source: Your app should also check that the scheme in the URI is HTTP or HTTPS since these are the only schemes supported by the [**Windows::Web::Http::HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639).
trans-unit.target: Your app should also check that the scheme in the URI is HTTP or HTTPS since these are the only schemes supported by the [**Windows::Web::Http::HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639).

trans-unit.source: Add code to validate a string for a URI from the user
trans-unit.target: Add code to validate a string for a URI from the user

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows::Web::Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.web.http.aspx) namespace lacks a convenience function.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows::Web::Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/windows.web.http.aspx) namespace lacks a convenience function.

trans-unit.source: So, an app using [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) and other classes in this namespace needs to use the **HRESULT** value.
trans-unit.target: So, an app using [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) and other classes in this namespace needs to use the **HRESULT** value.

trans-unit.source: In apps using C++, the [**Platform::Exception**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh755825.aspx) represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.
trans-unit.target: In apps using C++, the [**Platform::Exception**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh755825.aspx) represents an error during app execution when an exception occurs.

trans-unit.source: The [**Platform::Exception::HResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763371.aspx) property returns the **HRESULT** assigned to the specific exception.
trans-unit.target: The [**Platform::Exception::HResult**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763371.aspx) property returns the **HRESULT** assigned to the specific exception.

trans-unit.source: The [**Platform::Exception::Message**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763375.aspx) property returns the system-provided string that is associated with the **HRESULT** value.
trans-unit.target: The [**Platform::Exception::Message**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh763375.aspx) property returns the system-provided string that is associated with the **HRESULT** value.

trans-unit.source: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.
trans-unit.target: Possible **HRESULT** values are listed in the *Winerror.h* header file.

trans-unit.source: An app can filter on specific **HRESULT** values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.
trans-unit.target: An app can filter on specific **HRESULT** values to modify app behavior depending on the cause of the exception.

trans-unit.source: For most parameter validation errors, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_INVALIDARG**.
trans-unit.target: For most parameter validation errors, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_INVALIDARG**.

trans-unit.source: For some illegal method calls, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_ILLEGAL\_METHOD\_CALL**.
trans-unit.target: For some illegal method calls, the **HRESULT** returned is **E\_ILLEGAL\_METHOD\_CALL**.

trans-unit.source: Add code to handle exceptions when trying to use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) to connect to an HTTP server
trans-unit.target: Add code to handle exceptions when trying to use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) to connect to an HTTP server
